ai-tha-ap125:1.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
ai-tha-ap125:2.3_0: they say, “She is upright, he is a desire for the good,
ai-tha-ap125:2.4_0: I gave birth to a strong man,
ai-tha-ap125:3.1_0: At that time the Fortunate One
ai-tha-ap125:3.2_0: for the sake of the world’s enjoying the benefit of the world.
ai-tha-ap125:5.1_0: Your Majesty, you know all the time.
ai-tha-ap125:5.3_0: who is compassionate, out of compassion (for us).
ai-tha-ap125:5.4_0: as though they had been instructed in the great forest,
ai-tha-ap125:6.4_0: the Teacher in the world with its gods,
ai-tha-ap125:7.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap125:7.4_0: see the fruit of the good.
ai-tha-ap125:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pañcasikha.
ai-tha-ap125:11.1_0: Third was the third said to the Elder Nuns,
